bboxes.raw_text:
BOSTON - The Gillette Safety
Razor Company has announced
the appointment of John R. Oxley
as special repr


Oxley, who joined Gillette in
1947, is graduate of Howard
University, Washington, DC.


A former football star, he holds
membership in the Improved
Benevolent Protective Order Of
Elks of the World; serves as
vice chairman of the Somerville
R ecr cation Commission; was
1855 president of the New Eng
land Bowling League Association;
served as chairman of the Mas.
sachusetts NAACP Freedom
Fund Ball in 1858, and is an
honorary member of the Pigskin
Club of Washington, Inc, Of
which his uncle, Lawrence Oxley
is President.

BERKELEY, CALF - The
NAACP announced its total OPP
position to an attempt by the
Parents Association for Neigh
borhood Schools to recall the
entire Berkeley School Board
because of its plans to integrate
three junior high schools.


In statement released by the
NAACP West Coast Regional Of
flee, the School Board was
praised for its action ain adopt
ing programs to improve school
facilities, teaching, curriculum
and racial balance"


The Berkeley Board sis merely
discharging the obligation inn
posed upon 1t by the State Board
of Education and the California
Supreme Court, the NAACP
statement said. Accordingly, It
observes the support of the
entire community"

Rev. Rollins l.. Winslow, pas
tor of Wesley Methodist Church,
announced avacationBible school
will be held June Is 26. The
sessions will be held at the
church which is located at 1902
E. Washington. Hours are Mon.
Fri; $3.50 am. to noon.


School coordinator is Mrs.
voeuiion Bible School To Open At Wesley Methodist

Arthur Patrick. Assisting her
are Mesdames Betty Wilson,
Jimmie Davis, Mary Gilbert,
Shirley Hall, Lucy McCray, Olgia
Scott, Laura Laing and Miss
Geralding Mcdonald.


Children ages 5 = Is years
are welcomed.


For further information call
276-7528 or 279-4582.

William (Junior) Mosley, II,
leaves for Sky Y Camp at Pres
colt for the third consecutive
year.


William was elected president
of the student body at Tempe
High School.


He is a member of the Keys,
Kings and Lettermen' clubs.
He is a member of the Salt
River Boy Scouts troop and is
active in youth programs of Will
low Grove Baptist Church.


He lives at 324o South 4oth St.

Paul. on May l at St. Joseph's
Hospital. He weighed 7 lbs. and
Ii oZs.

DR.. and Mrs. John Fit, 1897
No. Seventeenth Lane, announce
the birth of their son, Arnold

NEW YORK Mary Davis, Negro at the Downtown
Beekman Hospital New York. appearing the New
Worlds Butterfly Girl Dancing
Pavilion in the Lake Amusement


Her ambition and dancer graduate York.
vile Vocational nursing
the Hill Hospital church scholarship
studied Berghoff Studios
appeared performances Union
Element House. She performed Fordham
versiy Playhouse dancing Guys Dolls Pajama

full articles.headline:
NAACP Opposes
School Plan
full articles.article:
BERKELEY, CALF - The
NAACP announced its total OPP
position to an attempt by the
Parents Association for Neigh
borhood Schools to recall the
entire Berkeley School Board
because of its plans to integrate
three junior high schools.


In statement released by the
NAACP West Coast Regional Of
flee, the School Board was
praised for its action ain adopt
ing programs to improve school
facilities, teaching, curriculum
and racial balance"


The Berkeley Board sis merely
discharging the obligation inn
posed upon 1t by the State Board
of Education and the California
Supreme Court, the NAACP
statement said. Accordingly, It
observes the support of the
entire community"
